result.execSummary:
The defendant Sava L Salaja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If not paid in full timely, defendant may be found in contempt of Court, ordered to spend up to 7 days county jail with huber privileges and the remaining unpaid obligations docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against you. The Defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the fine is paid in full.

If not paid in full timely, defendant may be found in contempt of Court, ordered to spend up to 4 days county jail with huber privileges and the remaining unpaid obligations docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against you. The Defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the fine is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
